title: Encounters | Materialities | Confrontations
description:
Encounters | Materialities | Confrontations: Archaeologies of Social Space and Interaction, edited by Per Cornell and Fredrik Fahlander, Cambridge Scholars Press, 2007.  
 

The social encounter is a particular sort of concept, focusing on confusion, 
ion, trauma, and possibly social change that may emerge in contact with 
people and things. A social encounter is, however, not only about negotiation or 
contemplating existence, but is rather about what happens when people interact 
actively, when they involve themselves with people and materialities, when they 
move around, fetch things, use things, leave things etc. The primary focus of the volume is the effects and processes involved in intra- and inter-societal encounters. All but one text in this volume were presented as working papers at sessions at the Xth and XIth European Association for Archaeologists Meetings in Lyon and Cork respectively
